TEXT.Russian: The sun rises on the year %s1_year. The %s2_civ people are ready to settle down and found your first city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, your people have vested absolute power in you, trusting that you can build a Civilization to stand the test of time!
TEXT.English: The sun rises on the year %s1_year. The %s2_civ people are ready to settle down and found your first city. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, your people have vested absolute power in you, trusting that you can build a Civilization to stand the test of time!
TEXT.French: Le soleil se lève sur l'an %s1_year. Les %s2_civ sont prêts à s'installer et à fonder votre première ville. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, votre peuple vous a confié le pouvoir absolu et s'en remet à vous pour bâtir une civilisation qui résistera à l'épreuve du temps !
TEXT.German: Die Sonne erhellt das Jahr %s1_year. Das %s2:3_civ Volk ist bereit, sich niederzulassen und Eure erste Stadt zu grьnden. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, Euer Volk hat Euch absolute Macht verliehen und vertraut darauf, dass Ihr eine Zivilisation errichtet, welche die Zeit ьberdauern wird!
TEXT.Italian: Il sole sorge nell'anno %s1_year. La popolazione %s2:2_civ и infine pronta a stabilirsi e a fondare la tua prima cittа. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, il tuo popolo ti ha conferito potere assoluto, credendo che tu possa sviluppare una civiltа in grado di resistere alle prove del tempo!
TEXT.Spanish: El sol se alza en el aсo %s1_year. Las gentes del %s2_civ estбn listas para asentarse y fundar vuestra primera ciudad. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]%s3_leader, vuestro pueblo os ha conferido poder absoluto, confiando en que podбis desarrollar una civilizaciуn que supere los retos del tiempo.

TEXT.Russian: A Mutual Protection Pact - Each Party Agrees to Automatically Declare War if the Other Party is Attacked.
TEXT.English: A Mutual Protection Pact - Each Party Agrees to Automatically Declare War if the Other Party is Attacked.
TEXT.French: Pacte d'assistance mutuelle : chaque partie accepte de dйclarer automatiquement la guerre si l'autre est attaquйe.
TEXT.German: Ein Verteidigungsbьndnis - Beide Parteien stimmen zu, den Angreifern der anderen Partei automatisch den Krieg zu erklдren.
TEXT.Italian: Un patto di protezione reciproca: ogni civiltа accetta di dichiarare automaticamente guerra se la civiltа alleata viene attaccata.
TEXT.Spanish: Un acuerdo de protecciуn mutua: cada parte accede a declarar automбticamente la guerra si alguien ataca a la otra.

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]The history of coffee begins in the 9th century. It is thought to have originated in the highlands of Ethiopia and spread to the rest of the world via Egypt and Europe. The word coffee is derived from the Arabic word Qah'wa, over Ottoman Turkish Kahve, which originally meant wine or other intoxicating liquors. Partly due to the Islamic prohibition on drinking alcohol, preparing and drinking coffee became an important social ritual. In the 15th century, Muslims introduced coffee in Persia, Egypt, northern Africa and Turkey, where the first cafeteria, Kiva Han, opened in 1475 in Constantinople. The stimulant effect of drinking coffee caused it to be forbidden among orthodox and conservative imams in Mecca in 1511 and in Cairo in 1532 by a theological court. In Egypt, coffeehouses and warehouses containing coffee cherries were sacked. But the product's popularity, particularly among intellectuals, led to the reversal of this decision in 1524 by an order of the Ottoman Turkish Sultan Selim I. From the Muslim world, coffee spread to Europe, where it became popular in the 17th century. Dutch traders were the first to start large scale import of coffee into Europe.
TEXT.English: [TAB]The history of coffee begins in the 9th century. It is thought to have originated in the highlands of Ethiopia and spread to the rest of the world via Egypt and Europe. The word coffee is derived from the Arabic word Qah'wa, over Ottoman Turkish Kahve, which originally meant wine or other intoxicating liquors. Partly due to the Islamic prohibition on drinking alcohol, preparing and drinking coffee became an important social ritual. In the 15th century, Muslims introduced coffee in Persia, Egypt, northern Africa and Turkey, where the first cafeteria, Kiva Han, opened in 1475 in Constantinople. The stimulant effect of drinking coffee caused it to be forbidden among orthodox and conservative imams in Mecca in 1511 and in Cairo in 1532 by a theological court. In Egypt, coffeehouses and warehouses containing coffee cherries were sacked. But the product's popularity, particularly among intellectuals, led to the reversal of this decision in 1524 by an order of the Ottoman Turkish Sultan Selim I. From the Muslim world, coffee spread to Europe, where it became popular in the 17th century. Dutch traders were the first to start large scale import of coffee into Europe.
TEXT.French: [TAB]L'histoire de cafй commence dans le neuviиme siиcle. Il est pensй avoir provenu dans les pays de montagne d'Ethiopie et de diffusion au reste du monde via l'Egypte et d'Europe. Le cafй de mot est dйrivй du Qah'wa de mot arabe, par-dessus Kahve turc ottoman, qui a signifiй au dйbut le vin ou l'autres enivrer alcools. Partiellement en raison de la prohibition islamique sur boire d'alcool, prйparant et boire le cafй est devenu un rite social important. Dans le 15e siиcle, Musulmans ont introduit le cafй dans Perse, l'Egypte, Afrique et Turquie septentrionaux, oщ le premier cafйtйria, Kiva Han, ouvert dans 1475 dans Constantinople. L'effet de stimulant de boire de cafй a causй l'кtre dйfendu parmi imams orthodoxe et conservateur dans Mecque dans 1511 et dans Caire dans 1532 par un tribunal thйologique. Dans l'Egypte, les cafйs et les entrepфts contenant les cerises de cafй ont йtй sacked. Mais la popularitй du produit, particuliиrement parmi les intellectuels, menй au renversement de cette dйcision dans 1524 par un ordre du Sultan Selim I. turc ottoman. Du monde Musulman, la diffusion de cafй а Europe, oщ il est devenu populaire dans le 17e siиcle. Les commerзants hollandais йtaient le premier commencer la grande importation а l'йchelle de cafй dans Europe.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Die Geschichte des Kaffees beginnt im 9. Jahrhundert. Es ist gedacht, in den Hochlдndern von Дthiopien und Ausbreitung zur restlichen Welt ьber Дgypten und Europa hervorgebracht zu haben. Der Wortkaffee ist vom arabischen Wort Qah'wa, ьber Ottoman tьrkischem Kahve abgeleitet, der ursprьnglich Wein oder andere Berauschenalkohole bedeutet hat. Teilweise auf Grund des islamischen Verbots auf Trinkenalkohol, der und Trinkenkaffee vorbereitet, ist geworden ein wichtiges soziales Ritual. Im 15. Jahrhundert haben Muslime Kaffee in Persien, Дgypten, nцrdlichen Afrika und die Tьrkei, eingefьhrt wo die erste Cafeteria, Kiva Han, geцffnet in 1475 in Constantinople. Die Anregungswirkung, Kaffee zu trinken, hat verursacht, dass es unter orthodoxem und konservativem imams in Mekka in 1511 und in Kairo in 1532 durch einen theologischen Gerichtshof verboten wird. In Дgypten wurden coffeehouses und Lagerhдuser, die Kaffeekirschen enthalten, rausgeschmissen. Aber die Popularitдt hat des Produkts, besonders unter Intellektuelle, zur Umkehrung von dieser Entscheidung in 1524 durch einen Reihenfolge den Ottoman tьrkischen Sultan Selim I. gefьhrt. Von der Muslimisch Welt Kaffeeausbreitung nach Europa, wo es populдr im 17. Jahrhundert geworden ist. Hollдndische Hдndler waren das erste, GroЯmaЯstabimport des Kaffees in Europa anzufangen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]La storia di caffи inizia nel secolo 9. И pensato avere provenuto nella regione montuosa di Etiopia e nella coperta al riposo del mondo via Egitto ed in Europa. Il caffи di parola и derivato dal Qah'wa di parola Arabo, sopra Kahve Ottomano turco, che ha significato originalmente il vino o l'altro inebria i liquori. In parte dovuto alla proibizione Islamica su bere di alcool, preparando ed il caffи di bere и diventato un rituale importante sociale. Nel secolo 15, Musulmani hanno introdotto il caffи in Persia, Egitto, Africa del nord ed il Tacchino, dove la prima mensa, Kiva Han, aperto in 1475 in Costantinopoli. L'effetto di stimolante di bere di caffи l'ha causato essere vietato fra fra l'imams ortodosso e conservatore in Mecca in 1511 ed in Cairo in 1532 da un tribunale teologico. In Egitto, i caffи ed i magazzini contenendo le ciliegie di caffи sono stato sacked. Ma la popolaritа del prodotto, particolarmente fra gli intellettuali, condotti all'inversione di questa decisione in 1524 da un ordine del Selim di Sultano Ottomano turco I. Dal mondo Musulmano, la coperta di caffи a Europa, dove и diventato popolare nel secolo 17. I commercianti olandesi erano il primo cominciare l'importazione di larga scala di caffи in Europa.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]La historia de cafй empieza en el siglo IX. Es pensado haber originado en las tierras altas de Etiopнa y la extensiуn al resto del mundo vнa Egipto y Europa. El cafй de la palabra es derivado de la palabra бrabe Qah'wa, sobre Kahve turco otomano, que significу originalmente vino u otro intoxicando los licores. En parte debido a la prohibiciуn Islбmica en el alcohol potable, preparando y cafй potable llegу a ser un ritual social importante. En el siglo XV, los musulmanes introdujeron cafй en Persia, Egipto, Africa septentrionales y Turquнa, donde el primer restaurante, Kiva Han, abriу en 1475 en Constantinopla. El efecto de estimulante de cafй potable causу que estuviera prohibido entre imanes ortodoxos y conservadores en Meca en 1511 y en El Cairo en 1532 por un tribunal teolуgico. En Egipto, los cafйs y los almacenes que contienen cerezas de cafй fueron ensacados. Pero la popularidad del producto, especialmente entre intelectuales, llevу a la reversiуn de esta decisiуn en 1524 por una orden del Sultбn turco otomano Selim I. Del mundo musulmбn, la extensiуn de cafй a Europa, donde lo llegу a ser popular en el siglo XVII. Los comerciantes holandeses fueron el primer de empezar la importaciуn grande de la escala de cafй en Europa.

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]It is believed that tobacco began growing in the Americas about 6,000 BCE, and by 1 BCE Native Americans were using tobacco in spiritual rituals and social gatherings. On October 15, 1492 Columbus was presented with a gift of dried tobacco leaves by the Native Americans. Soon after, it was brought to Europe where its popularity soared as people thought it cured everything from bad breath to cancer. The opposite, of course, was true. In 1847 Phillip Morris established selling hand rolled Turkish cigarettes. Cigarettes have served in every war since WW I, and have become entwined with images of war in the modern era. The active ingredient, Nicotine, is a highly toxic liquid alkaloid which has since been recognized as severely detrimental to health. The neuro-depressant is highly addictive, and also suppresses appetite while increasing blood pressure. New users experience a "high," while experienced users feel simple satisfaction.
TEXT.English: [TAB]It is believed that tobacco began growing in the Americas about 6,000 BCE, and by 1 BCE Native Americans were using tobacco in spiritual rituals and social gatherings. On October 15, 1492 Columbus was presented with a gift of dried tobacco leaves by the Native Americans. Soon after, it was brought to Europe where its popularity soared as people thought it cured everything from bad breath to cancer. The opposite, of course, was true. In 1847 Phillip Morris established selling hand rolled Turkish cigarettes. Cigarettes have served in every war since WW I, and have become entwined with images of war in the modern era. The active ingredient, Nicotine, is a highly toxic liquid alkaloid which has since been recognized as severely detrimental to health. The neuro-depressant is highly addictive, and also suppresses appetite while increasing blood pressure. New users experience a "high," while experienced users feel simple satisfaction.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Certains types de plantes ont йvoluй de telle maniиre qu'elles produisent des toxines rendant leur odeur ou leur saveur insupportable pour les animaux. Curieusement, ces odeurs et ces saveurs ont incitй l'homme а rechercher ces plantes. Les marchands du Moyen-Orient ont crй vers 2000 av. J.-C. un marchй des йpices extrкmement lucratif. Les йpices sont utilisйes aujourd'hui, comme par le passй, pour conserver la nourriture et rehausser le goыt des mets. Bien que de nos jours les йpices soient cultivйes et prйparйes а йchelle commerciale, la plupart peuvent encore кtre trouvйes en grande quantitй dans la nature. Certaines des йpices les plus recherchйes, comme la muscade ou le clou de girofle, sont extraites de plantes qui poussent dans les rйgions tropicales ou marйcageuses.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Bestimmte Pflanzen produzieren milde Gifte oder abstoЯende Stoffe, deren Geruch oder Geschmack Tiere fernhдlt. Interessanterweise sind viele dieser Pflanzen bei den Menschen gerade wegen ihres Geruchs oder Geschmacks begehrt. Bereits 2000 vor Christus entstand im nahen Osten ein profitabler Gewьrzhandel. Damals wie heute werden Gewьrze benutzt, um Nahrungsmittel zu konservieren und ihren Geschmack zu verbessern. Zwar werden die Gewьrzpflanzen mittlerweile kommerziell angebaut und aufbereitet, die meisten Sorten sind aber nach wie vor in groЯen Mengen auch in der freien Natur zu finden. Viele der beliebtesten Gewьrze, wie Nelken und Muskat, werden aus Pflanzen gewonnen, die in den tropischen oder sumpfigen Regionen der Welt wachsen.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Alcuni tipi di piante si sono evoluti in modo da produrre tossine leggere o repellenti per rendere il loro odore o il loro sapore nauseante per gli animali. Stranamente, gli umani cercano queste piante proprio per queste caratteristiche; i mercanti del Medio Oriente cominciarono il commercio di spezie prima del 2000 a. C. Al giorno d'oggi, le spezie vengono usate per conservare e condire i cibi. Malgrado al giorno d'oggi molte spezie vengano coltivate e preparate industrialmente, la maggior parte si possono trovare abbondantemente in natura. Molte delle spezie piщ popolari, come i chiodi di garofano e le noci moscate, si estraggono da piante che crescono in regioni tropicali e paludose.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]Este perfume resinoso es hoy en dнa un artнculo de lujo, igual que lo ha sido a lo largo de la historia, y produce una amplia y potente variedad de fragancias cuando se quema. La suma de flores, corteza de бrbol, madera y resina puede crear una fragancia especнfica que la humanidad ha incorporado a muchos aspectos de la vida diaria. El incienso se solнa quemar en un "incensario", que era un cuenco profusamente ornamentado. Los antiguos egipcios usaban este objeto en muchas de sus ceremonias religiosas. Dos de los tres regalos llevados por los Reyes Magos al nacimiento de Cristo fueron mirra e incienso, dos tipos de sustancias aromбticas. En la actualidad, el incienso se usa por las fragancias aromбticas que despide y en ceremonias de muchas iglesias cristianas.

TEXT.Russian: [TAB]Made from the leaves or buds of a bush, tea is the liquid created by soaking the extracted foliage in water and it is a popular beverage throughout the world. The "Camellia Sinesis," (tea plant), is grown in tropical and sub-tropical regions of the planet such as China or India. Originally from Southeast Asia, it early on became a staple in the diet of many person from the Orient. It was not until the sixteenth or seventeenth century that it was introduced to Europe as explorers crossed the globe in search of knowledge and treasure. Tea quickly became popular with the wealthy of Western Europe, and Britain would set up numerous plantations in its colony of India to help satiate the demand - India today remains the biggest producer of tea in the world.
TEXT.English: [TAB]Made from the leaves or buds of a bush, tea is the liquid created by soaking the extracted foliage in water and it is a popular beverage throughout the world. The "Camellia Sinesis," (tea plant), is grown in tropical and sub-tropical regions of the planet such as China or India. Originally from Southeast Asia, it early on became a staple in the diet of many person from the Orient. It was not until the sixteenth or seventeenth century that it was introduced to Europe as explorers crossed the globe in search of knowledge and treasure. Tea quickly became popular with the wealthy of Western Europe, and Britain would set up numerous plantations in its colony of India to help satiate the demand - India today remains the biggest producer of tea in the world.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Constituй de feuilles ou de bourgeons d'un buisson, le thй est prйparй en trempant l'extrait de feuillage dans de l'eau, et c'est une boisson extrкmement populaire а travers le monde. Le "Camellia Sinesis" (la plante) pousse dans les rйgions tropicales et subtropicales de la planиte, et notamment en Chine et en Inde. Originaire d'Asie du Sud-est, le thй devient trиs tфt un produit de base dans le rйgime alimentaire de nombreux habitants de l'Orient. Il n'est pas introduit avant le XVIe ou XVIIe siиcles en Europe, quand les explorateurs font le tour du monde en quкte de nouvelles connaissances et richesses. Le thй devient vite trиs populaire au sein des classes supйrieures de l'Europe de l'ouest et la Grande-Bretagne crйe de nombreuses plantations dans ses colonies des Indes pour rйpondre а la demande. L'Inde reste aujourd'hui le premier producteur mondial.
TEXT.German: [TAB]Als Aufguss aus den Blдttern oder Knospen eines Busches zubereitet, ist Tee zu einem weltweit beliebten Getrдnk geworden. Die "Camellia Sinensis" (Teegewдchs) wird in tropischen und subtropischen Regionen wie China oder Indien angebaut. Ursprьnglich aus Sьdostasien stammend, wurde der Tee zu einem wichtigen Bestandteil der orientalischen Ernдhrungsweise. Erst im 16. oder 17. Jahrhundert brachten Forschungsreisende die Teepflanze schlieЯlich auch nach Europa. Da der Tee als Getrдnk im reichen Westeuropa groЯen Anklang fand, legten die Briten in ihrer Kolonie Indien zahlreiche Plantagen an, um die steigende Nachfrage befriedigen zu kцnnen, und auch heute noch gehцrt Indien zu den grцЯten Tee produzierenden Lдndern der Welt.
TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ricavato dalle foglie o dalle gemme di un arbusto, il tи и una bevanda popolare in tutto il mondo che si ottiene immergendo le foglie nell'acqua calda. la "camellia sinesis" (la pianta del tи) cresce nelle regioni tropicali e sub-tropicali del pianeta (Cina e India, per esempio). Originario del sudest asiatico, ben presto il tи entrт a far parte della dieta di molti orientali, mentre fu introdotto in Europa soltanto nel sedicesimo o diciassettesimo secolo, portato da esploratori che giravano il mondo in lungo e in largo in cerca di nuove conoscenze e tesori. Il tи raccolse in breve tempo il consenso delle classi agiate europee e per soddisfare la domanda, l'Inghilterra creт enormi piantagioni in India, che ancora oggi rimane il piщ grande produttore di tи al mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: [TAB]El tй, lнquido creado por la infusiуn en agua de las hojas o los brotes de un matorral, es una bebida que goza de gran fama en todo el mundo. La "camellia sinesis" (planta del tй) crece en regiones tropicales y subtropicales del planeta, como China y la India. Procedente del sudeste de Asia, se convirtiу desde muy pronto en la base de la dieta de muchos orientales. Hasta los siglos XVI o XVII no fue introducido en Europa por los aventureros que cruzaban el mundo en busca de conocimientos y tesoros. El tй se hizo rбpidamente popular entre la gente acomodada de Europa occidental, y los britбnicos crearнan inmensas plantaciones en sus colonias de la India para satisfacer la demanda. En la actualidad, la India continъa siendo el mayor productor mundial.

TEXT.English: From the ancient world onward, patronage of the arts was important in art history. It is known in greatest detail in reference to medieval and Renaissance Europe, though patronage can also be traced in feudal Japan, the traditional Southeast Asian kingdoms, and elsewhere-art patronage tended to arise wherever a royal or imperial system and an aristocracy dominated a society and controlled a significant share of resources. Samuel Johnson defined a patron as "one who looks with unconcern on a man struggling for life in the water, and, when he has reached ground, encumbers him with help". Rulers, nobles and very wealthy people used patronage of the arts to endorse their political ambitions, social positions, and prestige. That is, patrons operated as sponsors. Some languages still use the term mecenate, derived from the name of Gaius Maecenas, generous friend and adviser to the Roman Emperor Augustus. Some patrons, such as the Medici of Florence, used artistic patronage to "cleanse" wealth that was perceived as ill-gotten through usury. Art patronage was especially important in the creation of religious art. The Roman Catholic Church and later Protestant groups sponsored art and architecture, as seen in churches, cathedrals, painting, sculpture and handicrafts.[PARAGRAPH:1]While sponsorship of artists and the commissioning of artwork is the best-known aspect of the patronage system, other disciplines also benefited from patronage, including those who studied natural philosophy (pre-modern science), musicians, writers, philosophers, alchemists, astrologers, and other scholars. Artists as diverse and important as Chrétien de Troyes, Leonardo da Vinci and Michelangelo, William Shakespeare, and Ben Jonson all sought and enjoyed the support of noble or ecclesiastical patrons. Figures as late as Mozart and Beethoven also participated in the system to some degree; it was only with the rise of bourgeois and capitalist social forms in the 19th century that European culture moved away from its patronage system to the more publicly-supported system of museums, theaters, mass audiences and mass consumption that is familiar in the contemporary world.[PARAGRAPH:1]This kind of system continues across many fields of the arts. Though the nature of the sponsors has changed-from churches to charitable foundations, and from aristocrats to plutocrats-the term patronage has a more neutral connotation than in politics. It may simply refer to direct support (often financial) of an artist, for example by grants. In the later part of the 20th century, the academic sub-discipline of patronage studies began to evolve, in recognition of the important and often neglected role that the phenomenon of patronage had played in the cultural life of previous centuries.

TEXT.Russian: Allows to build Versailles, the Sistine Chapel and the Leaning Tower.
TEXT.English: Allows to build Versailles, the Sistine Chapel and the Leaning Tower.

TEXT.Russian: "Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master; thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild." - Dante Alighieri
TEXT.English: "Art, as far as it is able, follows nature, as a pupil imitates his master; thus your art must be, as it were, God's grandchild." - Dante Alighieri

TEXT.Russian: The spread of %s1 to our city of %s2 caused its citizens to abandon their Pagan Temple.
TEXT.English: The spread of %s1 to our city of %s2 caused its citizens to abandon their Pagan Temple.

TEXT.Russian: The spread of %s1 to our city of %s2 caused its citizens to repurpose their Pagan Temple as %s3.
TEXT.English: The spread of %s1 to our city of %s2 caused its citizens to repurpose their Pagan Temple as %s3.

TEXT.Russian: [ICON_BULLET]Removes one non-state religion from this city[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Causes temporary disorder and unhappiness
TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Removes one non-state religion from this city[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Causes temporary disorder and unhappiness

TEXT.English: Religious persecution in %s2 has removed %s1 from the city.

TEXT.Russian: Гонения на какую религию Вы хотите устроить в городе %s1?
TEXT.English: Which religion do you want to persecute in %s1?
